title: Early morning Sunrise is mesmerizing
review: Watching sunrise from the top of a hill is worth all the effort. We started at 4:40 a.m. from tapovan, rishikesh and reached in about 60 minutes. Then it took about 350 stairs uphill and we were at the top enjoying hot tea/maggi.

title: a must see - espcially at dawn
review: Worth getting up at dawn to see the sunrise.  A lovely experience for everyone; a spiritual experience if you are so inclined. The views alone make it worth the trip.

title: The Most Beautiful Scenery in Rishikesh
review: It takes about 60-75 minutes to arrive, depending on whether you make several stops to take pictures of the Ganges along the way.  You can go during sunrise or sunset, but we went during the middle of the day and we really enjoyed it! We got blue skies and got to see the Himalayas's white-covered snow peaks. Truly one of the best experiences in India!

title: Worth a visit !
review: An hour - hour and half ride from Rishikesh. The way to the temple i.e. Tehri Garhwal/Srinagar highway is in bad state at the moment due to work in progress to mend it & make it wider.

title: Beautiful!
review: A small and beautiful Temple with amazing heights and views of mighty Himalayan mountains. Quiet and full of spunky and loving monkeys (just watch your bags, because the monkeys will steal your stuff, lol!).

title: Beautiful sunrise
review: The trip up to Kunjapuri Devi was interesting - continuously uphill drive from Rishikesh.  We departed Rishikesh at 5:00 a.m. so it was still darke when we reached the temple, but the very fist light just starting to colour the sky.  We chose our day well and had amazing sunrise views to the far snow covered Himalayan Peaks.  Definitely recommended - but dress for the cold weather at altitude.

title: Goddess temple on top of the hills.
review: Temple is situated on Rishikesh - Gangotri national highway, nearly 15 km from Rishikesh town. @ 2km hill side road from national highway is exact approach to temple. Lot of stairs to be climbed to reach temple campus.

title: Overrated on many levels.
review: Despite of the title of my review, it is an interesting vantage point as one can see the snowcapped Himalaya mountains. The road to the temple is in a despicable condition considering that tourists want to visit this temple. We did go later in the day, so, I cannot comment on the sunrise spectularity. However, the garbage and general disrespect of environment of the sacred spiritual site was, as usual, appalling. Aside of the spectacular view of the countryside, I do not recommend this site.

title: Wait for the sunrise
review: The temple is accessed by a staircase of 350+ steps

title: goddess
review: it is wonderful place to see sunrise .i did/ puja there.nice view of/ mountain .you ca/n see wounderful mountain from the range of himalaya..

title: Beautiful Scenery over the mountains
review: The temple itself was small but surrounded by amaizing views over rishikesh and the edges of the hymilayers. Try and go just as the sun is rising and the mountains will light up. There are a lot of stairs going upto the temple so ensure that you have a nice cup of sugary chai before you assent. You can purchase prayer flags and make offerings inside the temple.

title: Excellent place
review: Beautiful place  go early morning to see sunrise. On clear day can see range of Himalayas at distance. Quiet place to meditate on rising sun.

title: Spritual and peace
review: I had recently visited that place with my friends and its a very great to find something new within yourself. the atmosphere was very pleasant, calm and cold.

title: Totally worth the ride - especially at sunrise!
review: We experienced a magical sunrise - I highly recommend getting up early and watching the sun come up in this location!  A highlight of our 3 weeks in India!

title: History with a view..
review: It is considered as one of the shakti-peeths and hence gets in the list of must visits. The approach road was under construction and hence was time consuming. Once you reach there, you have to climb 150-200 stairs so can be little difficult for elderly people. Has a wonderful view of the mountains around. All in all a good place for people with devotion.

title: Sunrise is Beauty...
review: Sunrise was beautiful and enjoy, if you decide to go there, plan leaving Rishikesh early in the morning..and be there before Sun light shines..

title: A Shakti Peeth Temple
review: Kunjapuri temple is one of the powerful Shakti Peeth where the Upper Chest (Breast) of Sati had fallen when Lord Shiva was carrying the dead body and doing the Tandav when he was angry . And one of the body part had fallen here, this temple is approximately 1-30 hours to 2 hours away from Rishikesh. The drive is wonderful and when you reach the temple after climbing 200 steps you see the beautiful valley and if lucky can have the glimpse of the Himalayan range of mountains on a clear day or very early morning. The temple is divine and ambiance is peaceful you can spend some time as half way there is a snack stall which serves lovely Maggi Noodles and Snacks.

title: Spectacular views
review: An early morning drive up to meditate as the sun rose over the Himalayas.  I recommend the trip and taking time to savor the views and the peace here.  A hike down to Neer Waterfall is also highly recommended.  A beautiful day.

title: Blessing from Mata
review: Kunjapuri mata mandir is at a 90 mins drive from Rishikesh on the hills.

title: Awesome place
review: Far away from rishikesh but as soon as you reach and see the sunrise you actually feel relaxed . Beautiful place and nice temple

title: Sunrise point in Rishikesh
review: One of the best point in Rishikesh. You have to leave by 4 from in u have stay in tapovan. It takes about 1hr 15 mins by car. You have climb steps which is kind of tiring (a little bit). But the view it offers is exhilarating. Must visit.

title: First visit
review: My first review, beautiful temple with nice view. Good for trekking and enjoying sunrise and sunset from top

title: go for sunrise views
review: if its hot summer season better to reach here by road else if its cool season..better to trek..there are 2 ways to reach here

title: Nice temple. Great View from Temple
review: On our way to tehri Dam, we decided to go to Kunjapuri Devi Temple also. The road to the Temple was quite narrow. The driver was used to drive in hilly terrain and hence there was no issue on that. The temple has 385 steps to climb. Slowly we climbed the stairs. There are lot of Monkeys around the temple and one of the monkey snatched the packet from my hand. The packet had Puja Samagri. We could perform the Puja inside the temple. The View from the temple all around is unforgettable.

title: Sunrise to die for
review: I was in rishikesh for a weekend getaway and i decided to go to this kunjapuri mata temple to see the sunrise the way was not very tough but you need to start early as it is around 27-28Km by road you can rent a bike or if you are staying at Zostel they arrange a ca or jeep every morning so the sunrise was really amazing i was stunned by the beauty no words to elaborate it thats all i can say rest is for you to experience and do start early i started at 4 AM from rishikesh.

title: Great Shakteepeeth
review: This is one of the  Shaktipeeths in India This is the place where the Devi Sati's upper part of the body fell while being taken by Mahadev to Kailas.Almost every temple in Uttarakhand is on hill top. The road to Kuinjapuri devi is very narrow.  At Some places you feel that only one vehicle can go thru it.  Its very breathtaking view from the top.

title: Breathtaking Sunrise with picturesque Valley.
review: Visited Kunjapuri Temple alongwith my wife and one year daughter in last week of April 2018.

title: I did not like that much
review: Was good, but hate when asked money in every corner.

title: A great landmark with religious importance and modern relevance
review: Kunjapuri Devi is one of the Shakti peeths having relevance in Hinduism... People, however, can also visit this place as it is known as the Sunrise point... Drive from Tapovan takes around 1-1.5 hours in early hours of dawn. You can reach at around 5 in the morning during early summers (I visited in the first week of April) and can visit the temple along with witnessing a great sunrise from amidst the hills.. The complex has small shops that serve tea and maggi, so you can probably munch on it afterwards...

title: Must Visit Before Sunrise
review: You must arrive at Kunjapari Temple before sunrise in order to watch the sun come up. Be sure that you're able to climb 200 steps to get to the top. The view is awe-inspiring! Be aware that there are monkeys who are very excited to try and snatch something out of your hand that attracts its eye! There is also a temple that you can visit, where a priest chants and offers you kum-kum on your forehead as well as Prasad (an offering of small candy that is blessed.  This is what the monkeys love, by the way!) You can also leave a few rupees for extra blessings.  There is a snack shop mid-way up the stairway that sells chai and other goodies, if you wish to partake.

title: Enjoyed the hike to the temple
review: Witnessed a beautiful sunrise at Kunjapuri temple after hiking there in the pre-dawn darkness. Breathtaking views. Loved the pooja in the temple.

title: Beautiful view-spiritual place
review: I went there with my teacher who often took his students.  We felt like we were already up in the Himalayas - worth a trip.

title: Great
review: The temple has great views... Must go there  before sunrise usually leave at 4:30 am from tapovan rishikesh to not miss it.. There are 262 steps to climb... It is believed that the chest of goddess sati had fallen here  when Lord Shiva was bringing her dead body back to Kailash... It was one of the 52 shakti peeth.. Sunrise is just beautiful...

title: Sublime
review: An early morning start to get to the temple was truly worth the hour long drive to watch the sun rise over the Himalayas. This was followed by a 3 hour guided trek back down with breakfast at the guide's home on the way.

title: religious place
review: the temple is located on a peak and one has to take about 300 steps to reach. but after you reach the view is breathtaking. Apart from being a very religious place the lace gives you a 360 degree view of the shivalik ranges and the peaks of chaukhamba and bandarpunch ranges.

title: Shakti Peeth
review: This is one of the Shaktipeeths and the drive is amazing may take upto an hour. Divine bliss wen you reach the top. Must visit.

title: A Spiritual Beauty
review: One of the noted Siddhi Peeths or Shakti Peeth, "Kunjapuri Temple" is positioned at a height of about 1700 meters and around 15 km from Rishikesh. The temple witnesses a mesmerizing view of sunrise and sunset from the greater Himalayan peaks. Swarga Rohini, Banderpunch, Chaukhamba and Gangotri; these peaks of Garhwal Himalayas can be seen from this temple.

title: Beautifull Sunrise
review: Lovely temple, you need to walk 100-200 steps and then you get to a beautiful valley  and mountain view. Mind the monkeys! they are there to steal you in a second :)

title: Cool temple to visit.
review: Take a car trip early morning to see sunrise from kunja puri. If the sky is clear one can usually see some snow capped mountains far in the distance.

title: Bike Road trip
review: Great place must visit. We rented a Royal Einfeld bike for 1,050rps. Put Jackets and helmets. Memorable ride to reach the temple. 300 stairs to reach up. When you arrive, get a goodie bag before you go up for 100rps.

title: Really Nice Time !!!
review: The best and must visit the spiritual place in Rishikesh India. I went to this temple in my ttc program in mantra yoga school.

title: great way of temple
review: this is very old temple. it is 25 km from rishikesh and way to reach here was memorable. if weather is good you will enjoy. dont try in hot weather.

title: Beautiful for Sunrise
review: We rented a scooter in town in RIshikesh, left pretty early in the morning and made the hour long journey to this temple. Can't recommend this journey enough. We did it as a couple so scooter made sense for us compared to paying for a taxi into town. But the sunrise really was super awesome. The temple is also very nice and filled with many monkeys.

title: Stunning sunrise
review: We went there with our yoga family to see the sunrise. It is such a spiritual and overwhelming experience. The ride by taxi from Laxman Jhula is quite bumpy, so maybe do not eat much beforehand, but it is all worth it.

title: Thanksgiving Sunrise 2016
review: I traveled to India with a group of Yoga Teachers from the US and Canada.  We travelled to the mountain top for sunrise and enjoyed worship (Puja) and Chai Tea.  One of the memorable experiences of our visit to India, as we could see Tibet and Nepal from the mountain top. Namaste, Yogi G

title: awesome sunrise
review: we started for this temple at 5 am. heading towards the chilly weather to view the awesome sunrise which is a beautiful view. the pujari at the temple explained us the history of the temple and we enjoyed the sunrise while sipping on chai

title: One of the best sunrises you will ever see!
review: Seeing the sun rising in Kunjapuri Devi Temple is an experience you will never forget. Beautiful clouds and the incredible view of the Himalayas are waiting for you here :)

title: Worth the effort to visit definitely best temple experience for the views..
review: Its at the top of hills about 6000 feet  elevation and great view of surrounding areas. There are 174 steps to climb, I thought I was unfit and couldn't do that but had no choice and it did my body wonders.

title: Surpassed my expectations
review: I was so looking forward to visiting Kunjapuri Mandir, having read about its importance in Hindu religion.  It was about an hour’s drive from Rishikesh, and a further 300 steps up to the temple. The temple was beautiful and the panoramic view of the Himalayas was awe-inspiring. Meditating in the sunshine, in the company of the local monkeys, will never be forgotten. ️

title: Beautiful location
review: It took us 2 hours to get there due to road construction, the road was bumpy and dusty. Couldn't make it at sunrise, so we went for sunset. You have to walk a few steps from the parking area, not too many though. The location is beautiful and from the top you can see some of the snow-covered mountains in the Himalaya.

title: Beautiful view
review: Wonderful place!

title: Breathtaking spot
review: This spot provides a panoramic view of the Himalaya mountains. It's one of the most beautiful spots I've ever visited.

title: sunrise
review: wow, We got a chance to come here with some of my friends. I can not forget the thrill of seeing the sun rising in the morning cold. The peace of this temple impressed me greatly, I did yoga and meditation for some time here.

title: Lovely drive to a simple temple with amazing views.
review: We went unfortunately on a cloudy day and had limited views, the rare cloud opening was a lovely treat. I read varying step counts to get to the top of the temple, in fact I can right in the middle with 322 steps, the monkeys interrupted me once so I might be a step or so off.

title: awesome view
review: awesome weather early morning. peaceful place. this place was not in our list but we came here and enjoyed much. great view and good for early morning activities

title: Sunrise at Temple, Villages and Waterfall Trek
review: We had great views from the temple before and at sunrise in early October.  There were many foreigners there but it was very quiet.  A group had set up a dozen yoga mats in the rear that did not interfere.  Important to leave Rishikesh early enough.  We left at 4:30 AM.   Trek through villages and to waterfall was moderate level difficulty at times, but mostly it was easy.  My guide had very little information to say about the villages, so if you want more information and closer contact with the villages, please ask your travel company to do so.

title: Some melodious chirps and an amazing sunrise
review: This place is away from the hustle of Rishikesh. Its a famous temple at the top of a hill and that fact ensures a lovely sunrise.

title: Trek to the temple
review: anotherto visit place while you are near Rishikesh. I wonder why do all the old temples are situated so high? But they do give you a scenic view of the valley and a good trek for your body. The yoga is no more allowed near the vicinity of the temple and some freaks might falsely charge you for the same. So avoid it.

title: Temple amidst Mystic Peaks
review: This place is around 25 Kms from Rishikesh up on a mountain in the Narendra Nagar area. The ride itself is worth doing atleast once. You can have some tea once you reach the top. The sunrise is apparently which I happen to miss.

title: Revitalised
review: This temple is situated at a height. You need to climb over 300 steps but it is worth it. The temple has a panoramic view of valley. The temple is simple and soulful.

title: relaxing
review: You have to climb up to visit this temple but once you are here you just forget everything.  it is so so beautiful and relaxing.

title: Loved the location
review: Although it took us 2 hours of driving up on a very narrow winding road that was somewhat dangerous, it was totally worth getting up there!! Up above the Himalayas mountains sits this fascinating temple that was supposedly important to women. I loved the story & the scenery is breathtaking! Prepare to hike up 350 stairs up but once you are up, it's magical! Namaste

title: Temple great for sunset
review: Visit this temple with sunset, the views are amazing. RIng the bells walking up and bring a pick nick bag with you and water!

title: Shakti peeth
review: There are three Shakti peeths in the adjacent region of Rishikesh. Surkanda devi, Kunjapuri and Chandrabadni. Kunjapuri is hardly thirty kilometers from Rishikesh, onway to Gangotri. From the alighting point there are nearly hundred stairs  to be climbed to get to the temple. But the stunning view from the temple and the spiritual ambiance is rewarding. For the believers the importance of the place is due to the tongue of Sati Parvati having fallen at this hill after Lord Shiva decimated her body.

title: Amazing sunrise
review: It is very nice temple on the top of the mountain (1573m). We started our way from Rishikesh at 4.30am and reached it 10 min before sunrise. If you are lucky and weather is clear you can see great view there. Sunrise was so beautiful and after it we went inside small temple dedicated to Goddess Durga and got beautiful puja. I have been there 2 times and it is really worth to visit it.

title: Nice hike up to the temple and quaint place
review: Spiritually strong shrine. I enjoyed practising yoga here. Also this is away from the main city of Rishikesh so was peaceful.

title: Wonderful Sunrise & Spiritual Shakti Peeth
review: Really a amazing place with a wonderful Sunrise. The holy temple is also one of the Shaktipeeth of Navdurga.

title: Kunjapuri temple
review: This summer we visited Kunjapuri temple with family. Its located in Narendra Nagar . Temple is on hill side. Its a beautiful and cool place,

title: Very Holy and Energetic place with beautiful sunrise
review: it is one of the shakti peeth of Goddess Durga. this place is very quite and beautiful. you can see the Himalayan view along with the beautiful view of whole Rishikesh. you can do the hiking from Kunjapuri to Rishikesh.

title: Magical experience
review: In order to get to this viewpoint, one might take a shared-jeep. It takes almost one hour to reach to the stairs. After that, 10 minutes climbing up, and then... one just waits to see the best sunrise ever. It is absolutely magical and beautiful.

title: Beautiful temple and views
review: This is a beautiful temple, very peaceful. The views of the surrounding mountains are stunning. Be prepared to climb lots of stairs!

title: Awesome Sunrise Point
review: A complete 360 degree uninterrupted view of the sunrise, from the top of the mountain which we all saw for the first time. The temple is beautiful too, but the major highlight of the place is the sunrise. It is approx 30 kms from Rishikesh, and is accessible by road by a car or two-wheeler. The road is single lane and you need to be careful while driving or riding on it. You also get to see a complete view of Rishikesh City from Kunjapuri Temple. A must visit place.

title: Beautiful view and silence
review: I can highly recommend to visit Kunjapuri, if you need a little break from the noise of Rishikesh. The view is simply amazing.

title: authentic
review: gives the authentic feel of the Himalayas and shows the culture of garhwal efficiently. highly recommend

title: Magnificent view of the Himalayas
review: Everyone were waiting for that magnificent sunrise, sharing their stories. The sky turns red and the first rays of the sun directly falls on your eyes. The sun comes up from the Himalayas above the clouds making a perfect sunrise.Everyone wants to capture that stunning and mesmerizing view of that sunrise. That view was giving such a positive energy to all the people who were there. It was a life time experience and I found myself so grateful and thanking god for this life.

title: beautiful sunrise
review: We came here one early morning to see the sunrise. Was beautiful, so many mountains around and the sun rising.. after u can enjoy hot cup of chai :))

title: Best sunrise view..
review: Visited there while I was in Rishikesh. We left at around 4.30 am. It was a 45mins drive uphill. It's a small Siddhipeeth temple with a small view point from where you could get a 360° view of sunrise.  It's a very quiet and beautiful place.

title: Revered and Spiritual
review: Went for a trek to this temple during my last holiday at aranyam rishikesh and really liked the power of this shrine and also surroundings.

title: Beautiful place
review: We went early in the morning in October to see the sunrise. The view is stunning. It was a little hazy so we could see the snow capped Himalayas only vaguely in the distance, but the view of all the other mountains is so beautiful too.

title: Temple with great following
review: Temple is situated above 15 km. from Narendra Nagar on the top of hill. You can go there by car only.

title: Devi Temple
review: It is a steep drive up to see this temple but well worth it.

title: Great Sun rise view
review: This temple is worth the drive for the scenic view. We drove here at 5am and got to see beautiful sun rise.

title: out of the place
review: if you are in rishikesh try venture it out . about 50 km from Ram Jhula worth visiting this temple  .Pleasesure for trekking activity .Generall Cold place

title: Adventures
review: Me with my 3 more friends just visited the temple last week. We all just reunion after three years so this moment have to be so special to us. We all reach there by bikes. The temple have road till the foothills of temple. You can visit there any time. Cold place and gentle people there. All are so helpful. Take a stop at Maggie point there.

title: Good Devi temple
review: I went up for sunrise and felt it was definitely worth the effort to get there. I would have liked to have hiked down instead of taking the car, but I was alone and it didn't seem like a good idea.

title: High and peaceful
review: Be prepared to walk a bit..A lot of steep steps.The view is amazing, though. Best time to visit probably in the morning. One of the shakti peeth, the feeling is great there.

title: Peaceful and great views
review: A little strenuous to walk but in the end the views make up for the efforts. Good peaceful surroundings offering a good time.

title: worth it just for the road to go there , the templ itself is absolutly nothing.
review: I KNEW this temple was not worth it at all (it s nothing, just one statue in a room..)  but i wanted to go there bike riding, cause the ride in the mountains with amazing views and monkeys all the way was amazing! so go there to enjoy the ride to there,dont expect something to see in the end! take a motorbike and enjoy the mountain road and views till there!

title: beautiful
review: This place is vibrating with high frequency. I have done this a few times and i love the experience every time.

title: Beautiful sunrise
review: It took about an hour to get from Risikesh to the mountain top but was totally worth it. Absolutely breathtaking view from mountain top.

title: wow such heights
review: I went on a cloudy morning so I wasn't able to see the sunrise and missed out on some of the views. Yebeing there was not a huge crowd only the two of us we were the only ones there for puja. I do not recommend the food at the stall at the foot of the steps.

title: beautiful for sunrise&Yoga
review: Very powerful place for sunrise and Yoga/Meditation with Aarti. To be on time, we had to leave at about 4:30 on a guided tour from our Hotel (Yoga Villa) but it is worth it!

title: Ausm Sunrise view
review: It was the early morning in January we went to Kunjapuri temple for sunrise. It was totally amazing view of sunrise in morning.  I was amazed with the view.

title: The Best Sunsrise Spot
review: Kunjapuri Temple is 27 Kms from Rishikesh on the top of a hill.

title: A trek to Peace
review: Every time I go there, Kunjapuri temple has been a source of inspiration and peace. Last time we went, the clouds were touching us and we were moist when we reached there. It is unexplainable how I feel to be so near to nature and the spiritual vibrations... Standing on this height, you can observe the natural beauty and relax your mind.

title: Divine place!
review: The drive to Kunjapuri mata temple is mermering. You can see such beautiful views from the top. Carry a stole or jacket as it can be bit cold up at the top. Once you reach the temple, u feel so relaxed and peaceful. From the back of the temple u can see the himalayas covered with white snow. There is an old lady and a priest who stays there at the temple. And there is a guesthouse also, don't know whether it is available or not. To reach the main temple one needs to climb stairs which is very tiring. so old people be careful as there are lots of stairs. I have been here in my each and every visit to rishikesh.

title: Visit to Kunjapuri
review: It is one of the Shaktipeeths. Mata's chest has fallen here. Not much crowded. Good view from here. I met a couple there who had trekked from Rishikesh for 12 kms. No toilet facility if you need to use one. You need to climb a few hundred steps to reach there. Well worth it.

title: THIS IS A MOST VISIT TO THE TOP OF THE MOUNTAIN
review: You will need a taxi of bus to get there. there are many steps to climb, so if your old and not in good shape, you might want to sit quietly on bottom. when you get on top, there is a small temple to the Goddess Devi. go inside and have puja there, give a small donation and receive blessings from the priests. on a clear day you can see the higher mountain ranges.

title: A Historic Temple
review: The temple has a lot of history behind it. One can reach the place by car and then one needs to climb 312 steps. And there you are on the top at 6000 feet above sea level. Besides the prayer and worship at the temple, you can see white snow clad mountains of the Himalayas on a clear day. Worth a visit. One can also go trekking from Ananda resort, its a two and half hour trek.

title: Breathtaking views!  And an amazing hike down to Rishikesh past waterfalls!
review: I had the opportunity to go with Shivram Saini (you can reach him through Ramana's Garden Cafe in Rishikesh) and a few other tourists to see the sunrise over the Himilaya Mountains.  We then hiked down, stopping for breakfast, for a snack, for a swim in a waterfall and to enjoy nature.  Shivram is a great tour guide.

title: Revered Shrine
review: This is a very popular temple and any one who has a religious bent of mind should come here. The drive to this place is also nice.

title: Sunrise Point
review: This is the place to be, to see sunrise while at Rishikesh. About an hours drive from Rishikesh. The police opens this road only at 0430 hours or so, hence be there before the mad rush begins from the check post.

title: Spending 1 Jan 2016 in Kunjapuri Temple
review: Went with a bunch of friends from Yellow Guest House. Having good time with the glimpse of sunrise. Nice relaxing area for those who appreciate the nature. Good exercise from down to top. And really amazing view up there.

title: Excellent views, thrilling ride to the top
review: The ride from Rishikesh takes around an hour and is very exciting. There are plenty of steep sharp turns and the views of Rishikesh down below are really exciting. Can also see the Ganga and Bhagirathi rivers winding through the plains.

title: PEACE WITH  RELAXATION & TRUE NATURE
review: I'm very often Kunjapuri Devi dedicated to the Godess Durga Mata

title: What an Awesome View
review: Get there early and as the sun rises, the view gets simply awesome by the seconds. Not to be misses.

title: Great View of Rishikesh
review: Kunjapuri temple gives the panoramic view of Garhwal Himalayan peaks like Swarga Rohini, Gangotri, Banderpunch and Chaukhamba to the north and Rishikesh, Haridwar and DoonValley to the south it provides to the visitors. The temple Kunjapuri is situated on the top of the hill Kunjapuri 1,676m. high, 7 km away from Narendra Nagar, around 15 km from Rishikesh and 93 km from Devaprayag .Good Exercise of climbing 500 to 1000 steps to reach the place

title: Fantastic trek or even drive
review: great place, fantastic view..sometimes crowded with western tourist accompanied by guides clogging the car park.The trek from lakshman jhula is fantastic after the rains. not for the casual walker, the climb is stiff for about 2 -3 kms.  mostly deserted, only you and nature..beautiful beyond words. most will need  a guide or you may wander off the little defined trail..

title: A temple with a view
review: Kunjpura temple sits on high mountain about 1:30 hrs journey from Rishikesh. On a clear day you can the Himalayas. A beautiful place to feel relax and the view the beauty of Utarakhand.

title: Wonderful
review: Went to this temple and the the sunrise over the Himalayas. This was awesome.

title: at height maata rani ka mandir
review: I visited this place with my friend by my car. from narendra nagar it is around 10 kms away. last 3 or 4 kms are narrow hilly road and adventurous. if weather is clear u can see enormous view of Himalyan range.

title: amazing!
review: I really wanted to go and our driver was so kind to bring us for sunrise... the Mandir is very small but I loved it.. It is one of the Shakti Peetha so the energy is amazing! The sunrise was good too, unfortunately a cloudy day and we could not see the snowy peaks of the Himalayas.. great experience!

title: The Best Himalayan Views near Rishikesh
review: If you go to Rishikesh, you should catch a glimpse of the snow-capped Himalayan peaks. Kunjapuri Devi is the closest place to see them. It's only an hours drive and a nice walk up to the top.

title: Mata Rani -Temple on top of the mountain so serene so calm so quiet and yet so powerful..
review: Its a beautiful drive to Kunjapuri Devi Temple. Its on the mountain top and the weather is just too good. View is breathtaking where you can see the part of the Himalayas and the temple is so quiet and calm. Its a place that whatever you ask for will come true and you will like to keep coming back.

title: great ride
review: Great Ride. Amazing View Try to reach before 2 and leave by 5 it gets darker along the forest. Total peace can see Himalayas on clear day

title: Kunjapuri
review: Kunjapuri is symbolic for Parvati's love for Shiva. It is a sacred and spiritual place. It is a slight trek, but the view is beautiful and you will come back feeling blessed and rejuvenated. I would recommend walking there or going by bike.

title: kunjapuri is a holy place
review: Hiked from Rishikesh to the temple. Nice hike but watch out for the leeches ;)

title: excellent place
review: Kunjapuri temple is one of the must visit places in rishikesh, we also appreciate the sunrise and sunset view from the Himalayan peaks.

title: Nice view, Peacefull !!!
review: If you got a free morning it is worth getting up around 4 o clock and go to Kanjapur. Beautifull Sunrise, great for Yoga, Meditation or just simply experience Sunrise from 1600 meters. Its best when there is no clouds, but even then its quite amazing. 50 Minutes drive from Rishikesh on 'nice' road ;P.

title: very good
review: Try going on sunrise and enjoy the buety. we have take trek down hill from Shiva Shaktui guest house. Rak the guide was great fun and we also visit the water fall. good activiet for 1 day

title: Serene and stunning
review: This is an interesting temple dedicated to the Divine Feminine. It's small and sweet, perched on a hill. The drive from Rishikesh to Kunjapuri is picturesque. The view of the Himalayas from the Temple is awesome. One can sit on the benches provided for devotees and enjoy the view or have some much needed moments of going within. Beautiful experience.

title: Back in Rishikesh
review: Place is about 45 minutes from Rishikesh. You get good mountain view. However, you have to be ready to climb 250 steps equivalent to 14 storeys. If you have visited any hill station, you can skip this.

title: A must visit when in rishikesh
review: Need to hire a taxi to go up here.also, stop at hanuman temple nearby.

title: Surreal at sunrise
review: Small temple overlooking the Himalayas. Totally worth the trip, the place has a surreal feeling to it.

title: AYM DAY TRIP HIKING WITH AN ALTITUDE OF 1'645 M ( AYM YOGA SCHOOL RISHIKESH)
review: Kunjapuri temple is located with an altitude of 1,645 meters above sea level. This is paradise.This is divine mother temple (goddess durga) alongside one of the 52 power center around india and nepal as well visibility of many himalayan peaks such as Nanda devi Highest one in uttrakhand and second highest in india and 16 in the world.

title: Wonderful mountain top Goddess (Devi) temple
review: This ;beautiful temple devoted to the Goddess Parvati is a must also for those visiting Rishikesh... I have visited it many times and was taken there each time by my Indian colleage Dr Ram Sharma from Meerut near Delhi

title: Awesome Views
review: Beautiful place to go very early in the morning and see the sunset. But many stairs to climb to get to the temple without breakfast. So make sure to eat something before or bring snacks.

title: Religious Place
review: Devi Temple at height and drive is also nice. Crowded by devotees,neat and clean. Must visit it, self drive will be fun and one can trek down to Nir Gaddo Waterfall.

title: beautiful route
review: its a beautiful temple located in the hill-top, the view is majestic from this point.The journey is mindblowing, its enjoyable :)

title: YOGA TEACHERS TRAINING GROUP FROM AYM YOGA SCHOOL IN KUNJAPURI TEMPLE RISHIKESH.
review: Our kunjapuri visit .

title: Serenity
review: One place where in one watching you can understand phylosphy, culture and history of Hinduism. In front of Himalaya, this unforgetable place will bring you in a magic world of peace and serenity.

title: Peace !
review: To reach up to the temple you need to climb a little bit of stairs. Once you reach up there you will be amazed to see the surroundings around the temple.

title: the Best Sunrise!
review: Sattva Retreat organized a cab and guide for me. We went there to catch the sunrise. It was the best sunrise I have ever seen in my life. Truly worth it. Please maintin the silence their though.

title: Trek to Kunjapuri when in Rishikesh
review: The place is beautiful and If you like to trekit is advisable to go early morning and enjoy the sunrise on the way. If you feel tired easily you can also get the option of coming back in a Taxi or decide to do the same in reverse order(Go to the Temple in taxi and trek down - Is more fun and less tiring)

title: Peaceful place
review: What a beautiful place. You can feel the good energy there . The view is stunning .Very quiet place its also a nice place to meditate.

title: 300 steps to a newer me!!
review: For someone who has a phobia for steps, i had the will and determination to climb up 300 steps to the top of the mountain to visit and part at the temple. I have renewed strength and determination.

title: Powerful Goddess
review: This goddess is very powerful. Any one can see most of the peak of Himalayas. We went there with the friends early in the morning. The view from temple is so beautiful. We all are blessed by goddess kunjapuri.

title: Divine
review: Narrow road. would not recommend during rains or, even at night. However, the experience you get just be sitting there quitely can not be explained in words. Worth going for anyone who is spiritual or, is a meditator.

title: Excellent view
review: a place to recharge yourself. The drive up is through windy roads but it is well worth it. The feeling that you get from up there is truly divine. The view is superb.  One side you can see the ganga the other side the high himalayas and the temple is very special .

title: Nice Day Trek from Rishikesh
review: Its a temple  in the top of Rishikesh, the temple is dedicated to the Godess Durga Mata.

title: Temple visit with India Magical Trip....
review: Kunjapuri temple is one of the must visit places of Tehri district not just because of its story related to gods and goddesses but also for the panoramic view of Garhwal Himalayan peaks like Swarga Rohini, Gangotri, Banderpunch and Chaukhamba to the north and Rishikesh, Haridwar and DoonValley to the south it provides to the visitors. The temple Kunjapuri is situated on the top of the hill Kunjapuri 1,676m. high, 7 km away from Narendra Nagar, around 15 km from Rishikesh and 93 km from Devaprayag blessing the passersby.

title: nice hill place
review: atmosphere was great , great traditional , peace and silent place i love it  ....A nice place but to enjoy the views, one must come early in the morning.or late in evening than you can see the views ....

title: Amazing view between clouds
review: Its on top of mountain. And when its cloudy its an ultimate place to visit. Looks like you are in the sky and a scenic view of Rishikesh. Road to Temple is quiet typical. Easy for two wheelers and you have to go on around 250 stairs to reach there.

title: Yoga TTC at AYM
review: It was so Amazing to Visit the Temple and see the rishikesh from the top and is a nice trek.thanks to AYM Yoga School who has taken the whole yoga ttc group for spiritaul tour arround rishikesh. yoga teacher training at AYM is amazing including knowledgible teachers, peaceful location and friendly envirnment and on the top outing on sunday.

title: Great Views/Handout Required
review: It's a hike, literally (300+stairs on a steep incline) to get here.

title: sunrise
review: Very spiritual place.. famous.. and go there for the sunrise.. its awesome.. also gives an aerial view of rishikesh.. overall a must watch in rishikesh if you are staying there for few days..

title: The Route to Enjoy
review: Not just temple, you will enjoy route to temple and the view from there. If you are lucky and sky is clear, you will be able to see, Himalayan peaks from temple. The route to temple is narrow but awesome. Not very far from Rishikesh, you will be able to visit in day and return back.

title: Yoga, Meditation & Ayurveda with Yogi Arwind at Kunjapuri Temple
review: Kunjapuri Temple (Shakti Peeth) is a serene spot in the mountains at 1600 meters about 27 KM from Rishikesh in the Himalayas. Temple has a powerful energy. Beauty of this spot is you can see snow clad Himalayas and river Ganga from the same pick. Yogi Arwind Ashram & Kunjapuri Guest House are the places of accommodation at Kunjapuri. You can do - Few nights stay in Kunjapuri, early morning yoga & meditation, beautiful view of sunrise and satsangs & yoga training with Yogi Arwind. Beautiful weather.

title: Peaceful temple with glorious views
review: Reach this place before sunrise enjoy the sun rising and then head to the temple. Keep in mind there are 300 steps you need to climb, so wear comfortable shoes and appropriate clothing as you are visiting a temple. Pay your obeisance to the goddess and then enjoy the panoramic views.

title: One of the holy Sidh peeth near Narayan nagar
review: Devi darshan at temple gives a complete feeling of truely blessed.Excellent view of the valley from the temple which is situated right on the top of peak with 150 steps of stairs rest is road route well connected from Rishikesh approx. 35kms.

title: Amazing place to Visit
review: A very positive energy to experience..Defines Indian Culture and values..must go and check the purity..

title: Great view of the Himalayas
review: While visiting Rishikesh, this is a must. The drive to the temple takes little more than an hours but once you get there, the view of snow capped Himalayas is breathtaking. The temple itself is clean and well managed. Be prepared to climb 300+ stairs from parking lot to the temple.

title: The journey within matches the external wonder of this temple
review: This setting when viewed as a representation of "Heaven and Earth" is sublime......The view of the majestic Himalayan peaks is alone well worth this journey.....Then you have the spirituality of temple and the rituals of offerings and meditation that connect the sages and saints of all time.....Then you meet Yogi Arwind......A wonderful embodiment of continuing practice of Yoga and the practical application of Ayurvedic teachings......Take the time to meet with Yogi Arwind and enjoy his wisdom and friendliness......He is the real deal and will be able to share the experience of meditation with you.....

title: Great view of mountains...recommended for all Rishikesh visitors
review: Ascending 300 steps to get to the temple,which is located at the peak of a mountain is a tiring exercise but well worth it...

title: 8 km trek starting at the temple at 5 am.
review: What a beautiful morning hiking 360 steps to watch the sun rise over the Himalayas.  We received the tilak and blessing in the temple, then breakfast with fresh masala chai before hiking down to the Neer Waterfall.  The priest seemed like he was going through the motions in contrast to other Puja I have experienced.  But my overall experience was lovely.  And it was an act of utter faith, holding on as we road fast up hairpin turns with sheer dropoffs for an hour to get there.

title: Nice trek, great views
review: We trekked to the temple from Rishikesh (Tapovan). Easy to do, no need to take organized tours. Trekking up took us about 4 hours and down 2 hours. On a clear day wiyh good visibility, you will be able to see the Himalayan snow-capped peaks, like we did. It was very nice.

title: nice
review: all love to temple of kkunjapuri enjoyed with family at temple . nice location . too many stairs but love to paas all these . jusst away from city but nice view from temple to mountain

title: soooooooooo nice
review: it was so so so grate . I suggest to every one this temple and be care you shoud wear scarf and being silent don't lough allot

title: Kunjapuri Devi Temple – Best View of the Himalayan Range
review: We went to this divine place a few days ago. It is a superb place for the devotees. The entire environment is overwhelming there as some are doing pooja, others meditate and practice Ashana. We saw the Himalayan range right in front of us and it was breathtaking. Temple is neat and well-maintained.

title: Not interesting for me without a view
review: I took a one hour cab drive up to this temple. The road was long and  winding and the scenery was sparse trees, not lush mountain or beautiful or interesting for me. When I got the top, the clouds were thick so there was no view. I climbed up to the temple anyway thinking I wanted to have an experience nevertheless, When I got up to the temple, it was deserted, except for a blaring TV and some garbage.

title: Adventurous!!
review: Went there on scooty and had an amazing experience. The view form Kunjapuri Devi Temple is just speechless. Its like we are on top of the world. beautiful mountains are seen. one must go. roads are of good condition.

title: Kunjapuri Devi temple - Sati Peeth with excellent view of Himalayas..
review: Good temple to visit when travelling to Rishikesh. Kunjapuri Devi temple is one of the Sati Peeth and hence considered a holy place to visit. You have to climb arond 200 stairs to reach the temple. Once on top, you can see the breathtaking views of the Himalayan ranges...

title: pilgremege in Rishikesh area
review: A great temple to visit. We were lucky to have had a clear sky. So we were able to get a panaromic view of the Rishikesh valley and the mountains. Steep steps to climb and lots of monkeys ready to snatch whatever you have in your hands.

title: One of the Peeth Sthans if you're looking for one
review: Kunjapuri Devi Temple is one of the 52 shakti peeth and one of the thirteen Shakti Peethas in Shivalik Range.

title: Devi Temple
review: A Devi temple at the top of the cliff  on the way to joshimath from Rishikesh. A good to place to visit. Can be covered/adjusted  in itinerary in short time.

title: Beautiful
review: I went there to see the sunrise and just loved it. The view to the Himalayas is breathtaking and the energy and spirituality there is something to be experienced.

title: Amazing views of the Himilayas
review: what a beautiful place to visit . It is a must not to be missed.

title: Wonderful Shree Kunjapuri Devi Temple
review: Shree Kynjapuri Devi Temple is a Shakti peeth, it is where the should of goddess Sati fell.

title: Serene
review: We went up the mountain from laxman jhula at 5 in he morning to view the sunrise. One of the best sunrise experiences of my life. Trekking down from there took 5 hours. Beautiful countryside and waterfalls on the way.

title: Nice place to visit
review: Temple on peak of mountain. very peaceful, good for meditation and you can see the view of Himalaya.

title: Himalayan Sunrise
review: Sunrise over the big mountains is breathtaking followed by a 15km hike back down to Tapovan.  Well worth it.

title: Excellent View of Snow Capped Mountains
review: Kunjapuri Temple is located approximately 7000 ft high on a mountain near rishikesh. Great scenic drive to the temple is rewarded with excellent view of snow capped Himalayas. Once in the parking lot, temple is still a good 360 steps high. A small guest house near the temple offers a few rooms with great views. Temple and its surroundings are peaceful and you can easily spend couple of hours.

title: Best palace in Rishikesh
review: If anyone thinking to go Rishikesh so don't forget this palace. This is one of the best palace for sunrise view and Sunset view and also best option for Trekking from Rishikesh to Kunjapuri temple.

title: Amazing View
review: I went there for the first sunset of 2015, and the view on the mountains was breathtaking. A must see once in a lifetime!

title: nice
review: beautiful temple. love to see maa kunjapuri devi at himalaan range.. maa kunjapuri bless everyone everywhere

title: Peaceful and close to nature
review: It is one of the Hindu goddess temple situated at the peak of mountain around 60 minutes car ride from Rishikes ,some people like to track also, long back i did track with my friends and it was so much exciting to pass through jungle

title: Peaceful and awesome views
review: Kunjapuri Devi Temple is one of the must go place nearby Rishikesh. From road to view everything is so pleasing and beautiful. While travelling to Kunjapuri you can feel the freshness in air. One should drive carefully once travelling on the temple road as it not too wide on someplace for even 2 cars. To enjoy the road and view I would prefer Two wheeler (Though most of the tourist go by car but even if in case they can arrange).

title: Very peaceful and scenic
review: Kunjapuri Devi Temple is at the top of hills near narendra nagar just 15 KM from rishikesh,

title: sunrise and trek
review: the place is located up in the hill, very beautiful view especially rise in the morning, we went by taxi and come back walking through thr jungles and waterfall.

title: Worth Visiting
review: A historical temple at an altitude of about 5500 ft. It's a one and a half hour drive - a steepish road - from the outskirts of Rishikesh. The last few hundred feet or so have to be climbed on foot over concrete steps. Nice views all around ... good place to watch the sunset.

title: mountains
review: the height is awesome but the stairs r mare than i thought.but it felt gud when u reach the top.every where there are mountains.but if take yur telescope wid u then u cn also see badrinath from there.ask the pandit so that he can guide to place telescope at the right place

title: Great views!
review: Go for the great views! You have a climb a few steps and also confront a few monkeys, so, be prepared!

title: Fabulous views
review: Absolutely loved Kunjapuri Devi Temple.. I walked there through forest and farmland - but only the final 8k from Rishikesh - you can drive right to the bottom of the temple steps (159 I think)....views fantastic.....I didn't go and worship as I'm just a UK person  but took my boots off and walked round the 'parapet' to take loads of photos.

title: Excellent
review: The location is superb! The landscape of the Himalayans is beautiful. It is worth going there even though it takes about 30 minutes from Rishikesh. You need a safe driver as this is in mountains.

title: Divine and Breathtaking
review: This place is way far from usual hustle of rishikesh city, it has a terrific view once you reach the temple and is soo Divine to attend the Aarti , watch Sunset and just sit there..

title: Must go
review: The trip fulfilled religious urges as well as serenity to senses...the route is hilly, green n bful...the temple is on a mountain peak giving a great sight of rishikesh

title: Awesome breathtaking vistas
review: I went with a two friends and we had a spectacularly clear morning, it was possible to see the crispness of the Himalayan mountain range beyond from that vantage point. On the other side one can see to Haridwar and Dehradun.. with in a hour of being there the smoke from the glass factory in Rishikesh filled the clear valley with smoke. So we were extremely lucky to be there at the right time.

title: Well worth visiting
review: We visited as part of a 2 day trip to Haridwar and Rishikesh and it was certainly worth the windy road drive up the hill. We parked at the head of the road and bought a devotional gift for the blessing.  The many steps brought us to the temple with fantastic views over the Himalayas, terraced foothills and the Ganges.  We had our blessing and took in the views.  The major peaks were all clear. There was also some religious activity going on involving drums and shrieking women!  All part of the "amazing India" experience.

title: Kunjapuri - Great View of Himalayas
review: I would strongly recommend visiting this place.  The temple is located at a height from where you can see mighty Himalayas.  Visit early to up the chances of a clear sky.

title: Kunjapuri Sunrise
review: This is THE place to go for a true taste of a mountaintop temple close to Rishikesh. It is tranquil and naturally spiritual and rises to over 1600 m. Sunrise over the Himalayan foothills here is a deep, intense expression.

title: Excellent temple with a brilliant view
review: Unlike other temples, this is a very quite temple with it offering a beauty of a drive to the temple. The priests there are not money hungry like the ones at any other temples

title: Breathtaking, must visit!!!
review: Kunjapuri is 1hr drive from the main city and then u have to climb few stairs to get to the temple but trust me all this time and effort is totally worth it.... The amazing view of rishikesh in one side and himalay on the other side u can almost feel the inner peace and freedom... One of my best memorie..must must vist.

title: nice
review: i love to trip on this temple.. lovely weather . distance from the city is 25 km but nice place. nice location. love to visit again

title: very good place for meditation
review: holy place and natural beauty. the temples and meditation centers are worth to visit frequently. the people should go there to have the mental peace and spiritual practices.

title: Best View of the Himalaya
review: A 9 km climb uphill from Rishikesh via waterfalls & mountain villages - tough but very rewarding!  We went with a guide from Red Chilli - Dashi - highly recommended

title: Great sightseeing options..and great place to meditate.
review: The temple is on top of a hill about 20 km from rishikesh. A 1000 steps lead up to the temple and the valley view on either side of the hill top is breathtaking. On the rishikesh side you can see the meandering river cutting throught the city and on the other side you can see snow covered himalayan peaks. The temple itself has ancient significance and is a great place to meditate overlooking the himalayas.

title: Excellent view
review: The drive to Kunjapuri made some of my friends very nauseous and everyone was on tenterhooks by the time we finished climbing the final steps. Thankfully, when we reached atop it was worth the effort. Located an altitude of about 1,676 m  this small temple compound is serene and peaceful.

title: Peace and spirituality
review: With the hindu music playing alongside the sun rising over the Himalayas, nothing but peace and divinity can be felt here.

title: Temple with a Himalayan View
review: Kunja Puri is about 30 km from Rishikesh on the Gangaotri road. We stopped our taxi at several scenic places en route to enjoy the view of Rishikesh and the Ganga below. The Ganga Barrage at Rishikesh too was clearly visible. We drove past the town of Narendra Nagar. We had bright sunshine all along, and got a very good view of Kunja Puri from the opposite side as we drove up the mountain roads. Kunja Puri is about 4000 ft above Rishikesh.

title: Tranquil and Beautiful
review: I went up for the sunrise, and it is spectacular.

title: Amazing view to the Himalaya
review: Absolutly incredible like India is ... Came by Scooter from Tapovan/Rishikesh. The way is worth do go. You will find a very peaceful Temple on an altitude of about 1760 m and you will get a view to the snowtopped mountains of the Himalaya.

title: Nice view
review: Situated about 20 kms from Rishikesh, it is worth going there for a sunrise or a sunset. There are a few steps to climb before arriving at the temple but one gets a nice view as a reward. Half way, there is a possibility for tea or coffee and there even is a guesthouse. At tee parking lot, there are many stalls selling religious necessities.

title: Breathtaking view from the top
review: If anyone of you wish to see himalayan ranges do visit this temple. you surely will be able to see the tip of it. Also from this place you can also get the birds eye view of rishikesh & a line of blue water(Ganga) flowing across it.

title: Breathtaking
review: It is beautiful place to watch the sunrise, do sun salutations and meditate! although getting there might be tough - leaving 4.30 Rishikesh and then climbing up, but once you are there - you are so happy that you choose to do it!

title: the best sunrise view point at rishikesh
review: i have visited there many times it's only 25-30 km. from rishikesh main market . from there u can the best sunrise and rishikesh city view and the temple is also very nice and historical. must visit there once during your stay at rishikesh ... jai mata di

title: MUST VISIT THIS TEMPLE
review: Hire a car from aurora general store,and visit this temple and have a puja there.very powerful and great views of mountains.easy to get up there, and make it a half day, donations as usual when going to temple, and woman must cover up and be respectful. no shorts and cigerret smoking here

title: Worth the hike
review: If you like hikes, this one is great.  12.5 miles at a steady incline till you reach the temple on top.  Great views of Himalaya's from up there.  Takes 5-6 hours and you weave through farms...locals are very friendly.

title: Get High
review: A special place to go and view the Himalaya in all their epic glory, as well as witness the quiet activities of an isolated temple community

title: Beautiful views of the Himalaya
review: We went there in January. After the hustle and bustle of Rishikesh, it was an oasis of calm, peace and mountain fresh air. A stand out moment of our trip.

title: Amazing view over Tibet
review: I found out about this wonderful place by chance.

title: Om namay shivay !!!!
review: sometimes its good to take time for some spirituality. this famous temple in rishikesh is situated on a high hill where you can see the himalayan peaks. best to go for sunrise and sunset trips

title: Early morning Sunrise is mesmerizing
review: Watching sunrise from the top of a hill is worth all the effort. We started at 4:40 a.m. from tapovan, rishikesh and reached in about 60 minutes. Then it took about 350 stairs uphill and we were at the top enjoying hot tea/maggi.

title: a must see - espcially at dawn
review: Worth getting up at dawn to see the sunrise.  A lovely experience for everyone; a spiritual experience if you are so inclined. The views alone make it worth the trip.

title: The Most Beautiful Scenery in Rishikesh
review: It takes about 60-75 minutes to arrive, depending on whether you make several stops to take pictures of the Ganges along the way.  You can go during sunrise or sunset, but we went during the middle of the day and we really enjoyed it! We got blue skies and got to see the Himalayas's white-covered snow peaks. Truly one of the best experiences in India!

title: Worth a visit !
review: An hour - hour and half ride from Rishikesh. The way to the temple i.e. Tehri Garhwal/Srinagar highway is in bad state at the moment due to work in progress to mend it & make it wider.

title: Overrated on many levels.
review: Despite of the title of my review, it is an interesting vantage point as one can see the snowcapped Himalaya mountains. The road to the temple is in a despicable condition considering that tourists want to visit this temple. We did go later in the day, so, I cannot comment on the sunrise spectularity. However, the garbage and general disrespect of environment of the sacred spiritual site was, as usual, appalling. Aside of the spectacular view of the countryside, I do not recommend this site.

title: Beautiful sunrise
review: The trip up to Kunjapuri Devi was interesting - continuously uphill drive from Rishikesh.  We departed Rishikesh at 5:00 a.m. so it was still darke when we reached the temple, but the very fist light just starting to colour the sky.  We chose our day well and had amazing sunrise views to the far snow covered Himalayan Peaks.  Definitely recommended - but dress for the cold weather at altitude.

title: Beautiful!
review: A small and beautiful Temple with amazing heights and views of mighty Himalayan mountains. Quiet and full of spunky and loving monkeys (just watch your bags, because the monkeys will steal your stuff, lol!).

title: Goddess temple on top of the hills.
review: Temple is situated on Rishikesh - Gangotri national highway, nearly 15 km from Rishikesh town. @ 2km hill side road from national highway is exact approach to temple. Lot of stairs to be climbed to reach temple campus.

title: Wait for the sunrise
review: The temple is accessed by a staircase of 350+ steps

title: Excellent place
review: Beautiful place  go early morning to see sunrise. On clear day can see range of Himalayas at distance. Quiet place to meditate on rising sun.

title: Early morning Sunrise is mesmerizing
review: Watching sunrise from the top of a hill is worth all the effort. We started at 4:40 a.m. from tapovan, rishikesh and reached in about 60 minutes. Then it took about 350 stairs uphill and we were at the top enjoying hot tea/maggi.

title: a must see - espcially at dawn
review: Worth getting up at dawn to see the sunrise.  A lovely experience for everyone; a spiritual experience if you are so inclined. The views alone make it worth the trip.

title: The Most Beautiful Scenery in Rishikesh
review: It takes about 60-75 minutes to arrive, depending on whether you make several stops to take pictures of the Ganges along the way.  You can go during sunrise or sunset, but we went during the middle of the day and we really enjoyed it! We got blue skies and got to see the Himalayas's white-covered snow peaks. Truly one of the best experiences in India!

title: Beautiful!
review: A small and beautiful Temple with amazing heights and views of mighty Himalayan mountains. Quiet and full of spunky and loving monkeys (just watch your bags, because the monkeys will steal your stuff, lol!).

title: Worth a visit !
review: An hour - hour and half ride from Rishikesh. The way to the temple i.e. Tehri Garhwal/Srinagar highway is in bad state at the moment due to work in progress to mend it & make it wider.

title: Beautiful sunrise
review: The trip up to Kunjapuri Devi was interesting - continuously uphill drive from Rishikesh.  We departed Rishikesh at 5:00 a.m. so it was still darke when we reached the temple, but the very fist light just starting to colour the sky.  We chose our day well and had amazing sunrise views to the far snow covered Himalayan Peaks.  Definitely recommended - but dress for the cold weather at altitude.

title: Goddess temple on top of the hills.
review: Temple is situated on Rishikesh - Gangotri national highway, nearly 15 km from Rishikesh town. @ 2km hill side road from national highway is exact approach to temple. Lot of stairs to be climbed to reach temple campus.

title: Overrated on many levels.
review: Despite of the title of my review, it is an interesting vantage point as one can see the snowcapped Himalaya mountains. The road to the temple is in a despicable condition considering that tourists want to visit this temple. We did go later in the day, so, I cannot comment on the sunrise spectularity. However, the garbage and general disrespect of environment of the sacred spiritual site was, as usual, appalling. Aside of the spectacular view of the countryside, I do not recommend this site.

title: Wait for the sunrise
review: The temple is accessed by a staircase of 350+ steps

title: Excellent place
review: Beautiful place  go early morning to see sunrise. On clear day can see range of Himalayas at distance. Quiet place to meditate on rising sun.

title: Early morning Sunrise is mesmerizing
review: Watching sunrise from the top of a hill is worth all the effort. We started at 4:40 a.m. from tapovan, rishikesh and reached in about 60 minutes. Then it took about 350 stairs uphill and we were at the top enjoying hot tea/maggi.

title: a must see - espcially at dawn
review: Worth getting up at dawn to see the sunrise.  A lovely experience for everyone; a spiritual experience if you are so inclined. The views alone make it worth the trip.

title: The Most Beautiful Scenery in Rishikesh
review: It takes about 60-75 minutes to arrive, depending on whether you make several stops to take pictures of the Ganges along the way.  You can go during sunrise or sunset, but we went during the middle of the day and we really enjoyed it! We got blue skies and got to see the Himalayas's white-covered snow peaks. Truly one of the best experiences in India!

title: Worth a visit !
review: An hour - hour and half ride from Rishikesh. The way to the temple i.e. Tehri Garhwal/Srinagar highway is in bad state at the moment due to work in progress to mend it & make it wider.

title: Beautiful!
review: A small and beautiful Temple with amazing heights and views of mighty Himalayan mountains. Quiet and full of spunky and loving monkeys (just watch your bags, because the monkeys will steal your stuff, lol!).

title: Beautiful sunrise
review: The trip up to Kunjapuri Devi was interesting - continuously uphill drive from Rishikesh.  We departed Rishikesh at 5:00 a.m. so it was still darke when we reached the temple, but the very fist light just starting to colour the sky.  We chose our day well and had amazing sunrise views to the far snow covered Himalayan Peaks.  Definitely recommended - but dress for the cold weather at altitude.

title: Goddess temple on top of the hills.
review: Temple is situated on Rishikesh - Gangotri national highway, nearly 15 km from Rishikesh town. @ 2km hill side road from national highway is exact approach to temple. Lot of stairs to be climbed to reach temple campus.

title: Overrated on many levels.
review: Despite of the title of my review, it is an interesting vantage point as one can see the snowcapped Himalaya mountains. The road to the temple is in a despicable condition considering that tourists want to visit this temple. We did go later in the day, so, I cannot comment on the sunrise spectularity. However, the garbage and general disrespect of environment of the sacred spiritual site was, as usual, appalling. Aside of the spectacular view of the countryside, I do not recommend this site.

title: Wait for the sunrise
review: The temple is accessed by a staircase of 350+ steps

title: Excellent place
review: Beautiful place  go early morning to see sunrise. On clear day can see range of Himalayas at distance. Quiet place to meditate on rising sun.
